tweets.text: Today is #bivisibilityday2020 , and in #construction I am proud to be an out Bi #Trans employee. Looking Back in 2017 we were proud to join up with @EnvAgency @balfourbeatty and @thames_barrier to run the first ever #BiVisibilityDay event in #construction https://t.co/hVebVEfqGk

Today we let the water through our first completed #FishPassage the RiverSevern üôå #LetItFlow #FishPassage @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW @CanalRiverTrust @fishmigration @LIFEprogramme @HeritageFundM_E @kiergroup https://t.co/M5LzxjUZNu

Here's @DaveThroupEA explaining what a big moment this is for our project, for all our partners @EnvAgency,@severnrivers @CanalRiverTrust @NaturalEngland for #TwaiteShad and for all fish on the #RiverSevern üêüüêüüêü #FishPassage #FollowTheShad @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWalesandSW https://t.co/GFndvLcELB

urls.title: Living Atlas of the World | ArcGIS
urls.description: ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World is the foremost collection of geographic information from around the globe. It includes maps, apps, and data layers to support your work.

tweets.text: We're pleased to announce the @EnvAgency have nominated 10 layers into the @LivingAtlas for the UK. We will be showcasing individual layers over the coming weeks üåç You can explore the layers for yourself here: https://t.co/S2EzqWDEto https://t.co/eVloRWvFav

@Countrymaned @EnvAgency @RibbleTrust @JackSpees @RibbleLife @JackPerksPhoto I‚Äôm not sure someone is missing the point. All that time and effort, collaboration and partnership working, 3 decades of it, all amounted to nothing. 

Not a single river in England reaches ‚ÄòGood‚Äô surface water status and yet some still clamour to repeat the same failed strategy.

I was really pleased to get to speak at #GMGreenCity this morning about the environment, health and all the great green things going on in #Manchester and around the country at the moment. My speech here: https://t.co/iJi8HCeV1w https://t.co/vymgoxYxug

Fabulous day for peatland restoration at Steng Moss. Joint site visit with @OurRedesdale and @NlandNP. The project is part of @HeritageFundUK part funded by the Environment Agency. #sunnyday #peatlandrestoration https://t.co/OP4r9KJPQt

tweets.text: The @InvasiveSp Floating Pennywort has been introduced from America. It can grow up to 20 cm a day & forms dense mats, disrupting the flow of water & the movement of animals. It also impacts the water temperature & dissolved oxygen levels, leading to fish deaths #PlantHealthWeek https://t.co/Ego9xtuyzB

urls.title: Home - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: First published in 2008 and updated in 2015 the GB Invasive Non-native Species Strategy was developed to meet the challenge posed by invasive non-native species in Great Britain. This website provides tools and information for those working to support the strategy.

tweets.text:
It's #PlantHealthWeek! @EnvAgency is working towards eradicating Water Primrose which is invading ponds, lakes, wetlands & waterways. This @InvasiveSp was introduced to the UK as an ornamental aquatic plant & is now banned from sale. For more: https://t.co/5crRIhAQUW
#BePlantWise https://t.co/EcD3WeS2uf

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
